entries.meaning: A manifesto or formal public declaration, originally political; a proclamation. [from 19th c.]
examples: After assembling an army in Catalonia, he marched on Madrid, issuing en route a pronunciamento calling on the Queen Regent to banish Valenzuela and to accept him as her first minister.

entries.meaning: In Mexico and Latin America, an uprising or insurrection. [from 19th c.]
examples: [H]e did not want to see Brazil suffer the same fate as those South American countries whose history has been nothing but a succession of barrack-room pronunciamentos.
